text: Mohamed Camara (born 6 January 2000) is a Malian professional footballer. He plays as a midfielder for French Ligue 1 club AS Monaco and the Mali national team. ==Career== He started his career with AS Real Bamako. 2018 he went to FC Red Bull Salzburg in the Austrian Bundesliga. FC Red Bull Salzburg Official Homepage (German) He then played for the farmteam FC Liefering. In February 2018 he debuted versus FC Blau-Weiß Linz. Camara scored his first goal in March 2018 versus TSV Hartberg. In January 2019 he went on loan to TSV Hartberg in the Bundesliga. He made his debut in March 2019 versus FC Wacker Innsbruck. After the end of the loan he became part of the FC Red Bull Salzburg squad. In August 2022 Camara went to the French club AS Monaco.Homepagse RB Salzburg (German) ==National team== Camara played for Mali U17, U20 and U23. With the U20 he won 2019 the U-20 Africa Cup of Nations. On 13 October 2019 he played his first match for the Mali national football team versus South Africa. ==Doping ban== In November 2020 Mohamed Camara and Sekou Koita were suspended for three months. The team doctor gave them a medicine against altitude sickness which included forbidden components.FC Red Bull Salzburg Official Homepage ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National cup Europe Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Liefering 2017–18 2.
